sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Spanish giants Real Madrid will be hoping to maintain their perfect start to their Champions League campaign when they travel to southern Italy to take on Napoli this evening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Apart from a loss to their bitter rivals Atletico Madrid, Carlo Ancelotti's men have won all of their fixtures this season and currently sit top of La Liga.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Whilst Real Madrid outclassed Girona over the weekend, Napoli will enter the contest off the back of a thumping 4-0 victory over Lecce in Serie A.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Italian champions, led by the in-form Victor Osserman, have won three of their last four matches in all competitions, including a 2-1 victory over Braga in their Champions League opener.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Both sides last met in the knockout phase in 2017, with the Spanish giants winning 3-1 both home and away to advance into the quarter-finals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In Group C's other game, Union Berlin will be aiming to end a five-game losing run in all competitions when they host Braga.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In Group A, Manchester United will be looking to bounce back from their loss to Bayern Munich when they take on Galatasaray at Old Trafford.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Elsewhere, Mikel Arteta's Arsenal will lock horns with French side Lens following their emphatic win over PSV Eindhoven at the Emirates.
